tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE Quantum_Communication_Protocols (
  protocol_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  protocol_name VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT,
  creator VARCHAR(50),
  creation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE Protocol_Steps (
  step_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  protocol_id INT,
  step_name VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT,
  step_order INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (protocol_id) REFERENCES Quantum_Communication_Protocols(protocol_id)
)

CREATE TABLE Researchers (
  researcher_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  researcher_name VARCHAR(50),
  affiliation VARCHAR(100),
  email VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE quantum_protocols (
  protocol_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  protocol_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  protocol_description TEXT,
  protocol_author VARCHAR(100),
  created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE protocol_steps (
  step_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  protocol_id UUID REFERENCES quantum_protocols(protocol_id),
  step_number INTEGER,
  step_description TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE protocol_metrics (
  metric_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  step_id INTEGER REFERENCES protocol_steps(step_id),
  metric_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  metric_value FLOAT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE protocol_results (
  result_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  protocol_id UUID REFERENCES quantum_protocols(protocol_id),
  result_description TEXT,
  result_value FLOAT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE quantum_devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(50),
    manufacturer VARCHAR(50),
    protocol_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (protocol_id) REFERENCES quantum_protocols(protocol_id)
);

CREATE TABLE quantum_parameters (
    parameter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    parameter_name VARCHAR(50),
    value FLOAT,
    protocol_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (protocol_id) REFERENCES quantum_protocols(protocol_id)
);

CREATE TABLE user_access (
    access_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    protocol_id INT,
    access_level INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (user_id) REFERENCES users(user_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (protocol_id) REFERENCES quantum_protocols(protocol_id)
);
